document.docAuthor: Shimizu, Akira, Lelej, Arkady S., Loktionov, Valery M., Nishimoto, Yutaka & Endo, Tomoji
document.docTitle: Dipogon (Stigmatodipogon) budrisi Shimizu & Lelej & Loktionov & Nishimoto & Endo 2018, comb. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the subgenus Stigmatodipogon Ishikawa of the genus Dipogon Fox (Hymenoptera: Pompilidae: Pepsinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the subgenus Stigmatodipogon Ishikawa of the genus Dipogon Fox (Hymenoptera: Pompilidae: Pepsinae)

heading.emphasis:
1.
Dipogon ( Stigmatodipogon ) budrisi ( Loktionov & Lelej, 2014 )
, comb. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: ( Figs 1 , 2 )

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Stigmatodipogon budrisi
Loktionov & Lelej, 2014 : 158
, 160, ♀ ♂ ( holotype ♂ , Russia , Kuril Islands, Kunashir Island, 2 km NE Tretyakovo, 10.viii.1986 (E. Budris) [IBSS], examined).

subSubSection.paragraph: Body with short, greyish- to yellowish-white pubescence. Not setose; vertex and dorsa of pro- and mesonota with a few pale setae; clypeus preapically and mandible with long yellowish-brown bristles arising from somewhat large pores; metasomal sterna with sparse brown bristles (terga V, VI and sternum VI missing).

Mid and hind tibiae with a few minute spines laterally. Longer spur of hind tibia 0.5 × hind tarsomere I length. Hind tarsomeres I–IV thin; tarsomere V slightly enlarged, its length 1.3 × tarsomere IV length, its width 1.2 × tarsomere IV width. Tarsal claws with small acute tooth preapically.

Fore wing shown in
Fig. 1F
. Pterostigma length 1.9 × SMC2 length, its width 0.78 × SMC2 width. SMC2 length 0.71 × width, narrowed on vein Rs by 0.72 × its own length on vein M , receiving crossvein 1m-cu at basal 0.44. SMC3 length 1.3 × width, 1.1 × SMC2 length on vein M , 1.0 × SMC2 length on vein Rs , narrowed on vein Rs by 0.65 × its own length on vein M , receiving crossvein 2m-cu at basal 0.43. Crossvein 2rs-m barely curved. Crossvein 3rs-m arcuate. Hind wing crossvein cu-a forming obtuse angle with vein A , short and slightly sinuate ( Fig. 1G ).
Setae sparse; a pair of setae on vertex close to inner orbits and setae on clypeus, mandible, gena, postgena, propleuron, mesosternum and fore coxa comparatively long.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1 .
Dipogon ( Stigmatodipogon ) budrisi
, holotype, ♀. A. Head and pronotum, dorsal view. B. Head, frontal view. C. Whole body, lateral view. D. Head and pronotum, lateral view. E. Head, pro-, meso- and metanota, dorsal view. F. Fore wing. G. Hind wing. H. Mesosoma anteriorly, lateral view. I. Metasomal tergum I basally, dorsal view. Scale bars: 1 mm for C, 0.1 mm for I, 0.5 mm for others.

FIGURE 2 .
Dipogon ( Stigmatodipogon ) budrisi
, paratype, ♂. A. Head, pronotum and scutum, dorsal view. B. Metasomal tergum I basally, dorsal view. C. Whole body, lateral view. D. Head, frontal view. E. Head and pronotum, lateral view. F. Fore wing. G. Hind wing. H. Metasomal sternum VII and SGP, ventral view. I. Genitalia, ventral view. Scale bars: 1 mm for C, 0.1 mm for B, 0.2 mm for H, I, 0.5 mm for others (H, I from Loktionov & Lelej 2014).

subSubSection.paragraph: Wings shown in Figs 2F and 2G . Pterostigma length 2.4 × SMC2 length, its width 0.85 × SMC2 width. SMC2 length 1.3 × width, narrowed on vein Rs by 0.82 × its own length on vein M , receiving crossvein 1m-cu at basal 0.56; SMC3 length 1.2 × width, 1.1 × SMC2 length on vein M , 0.64 × SMC2 length on vein Rs , narrowed on vein Rs by 0.49 × its own length on vein M , receiving crossvein 2m-cu at basal 0.32. Crossvein 3rs-m strongly sinuate.
Longer spur of hind tibia 0.60 × hind tarsomere I length. Tarsal claws with minute tooth preapically.

Material examined .
Paratype
. RUSSIA . Kuril Islands , Kunashir Island : 1♂ ,
2 km NE Tretyakovo
,
10.viii.1986
( E. Budris ) [ IBSS ]
.
Distribution . Russia (Far East: Kunashir Island).
Biology . Unknown.
